Yes the game is great.  SIngle player is boring. Multiplayer online is where the game shines. So many weapons. SLow motion to allow you to get nice headshots. Scary zombies and lots of them. So good and scary. Graphics are not the best. However fun is the name of this game. People are friendly and their are many servers to choose from. THe dlc weapons and characters are great. Not needed to enjoy the game but they are fun to use. Play and enjoy the game. Remember to go onlne and try this. The game just shines like a beacon when playing with real people. Big recommendation from me.

Lorsqu'on parle de jeux de tueries de zombies, on mentionne g√©n√©ralement deux immanquables: Left 4 Dead 2 et Killing Floor.


Killing Floor est un jeu dans lequel vous jouez jusqu'√† 6 joueurs dans des maps aux d√©cors divers et tentez de survivre √† des vagues de zombies (plus exactement des clones, mais on va simplifier pour ce bref descriptif) dont le nombre est proportionnel au nombre de joueurs. Vous gagnerez de l'argent √† chaque fin de vague ainsi qu'√† chaque frag ; autant dire que √ßa se bastonne pour tuer le moindre petit zombie paum√©.

Une fois que vous aurez compris que la devise utilis√©e est la Livre Sterling, une vendeuse (et oui, m√™me pendant l'apocalypse, on ne crache pas sur le beaf) apparaitra dans un endroit al√©atoire de la map, dont la position vous sera indiqu√©e par une fl√®che en haut √† gauche de l'√©cran ainsi que par une train√©e rouge pour vous guider, histoire de ne pas se perdre tant certaines maps sont des labyrinthes.

Vous aurez alors la possibilit√© d'acheter des armes diverses, dont la quantit√© est limit√©e par un indice de poids. Mais comment choisir son arme ?

Il existe des perks (des classes). Selon celle que vous selectionnez, vous aurez des bonus li√©s √† un type d'arme: armes incendiaires, explosifs ou encore armes de corps-√†-corps, il y en a pour tout le monde. Chaque perk poss√®de un compteur li√© √† un type d'actions que vous devez accomplir (infliger des d√©gats avec le type d'armes li√© au perk par exemple) qui, lorsqu'il passe un cap, vous octroie un niveau et augmente les bonus. Il y a 6 niveaux pour chaque perk.

Graphiquement, c'est super pour un jeu de zombies et on n'en attendra pas plus, si ce n'est quelques rares endroits dans certaines maps qui sont glitch√©s et parfois bloquent un mob, ce qui obligera √† venir jusqu'√† lui pour en finir au lieu de l'inverse.

Musicalement, c'est jouissif. La BO est majoritairement constitu√©e de m√©tal, et c'est le pied lorsqu'on d√©membre des chauves pleins de sang √† coups de chevrotine ! J'ai tout de m√™me remplac√© certaines musiques assez agacantes (comme celles des maps Noel) par des chansons de Metallica, et √ßa s'int√®gre merveilleusement bien.

Il existe 5 niveaux de difficult√© qui vous mettront √† l'√©preuve: D√©butant, Normal, Difficile, Suicidaire et Enfer sur Terre (pour les √©numerer en fran√ßais). Lorsque vous entendrez la voix de la marchande d'armes en fran√ßais, vous la changerez tout de suite, faites moi confiance. Enfin, il existe pas mal de types de zombies, tous avec leurs propres attributs; c'est riche et difficile, on aime.

Ce jeu requiert un teamplay parfait car on peut se faire litt√©ralement d√©foncer d√®s la 3e vague si les joueurs merdent. D√©tail important : √† la fin des 10 vagues, une 11e vous oppose au Patriarche, sorte de bureaucrate zombifi√© √† l'origine des zombies, en guise de boss.

Cependant, il y a malheureusement trop peu de servers du fait de la d√©sertion de beaucoup de joueurs pour le num√©ro 2. Les hitbox des t√™tes d√©connent parfois, ce qui fait que vous n'infligez pas toujours de headshots m√™me si vous visez au sniper √† deux m√®tres de votre cible et enfin, certains succ√®s sont bugu√©s.


En conclusion, nous avons ici un excellent jeu que je ne peux que recommander. A vous de jouer d√©sormais.

Made using one of the Unreal Tournament engines (UT2K4 I assume), and they don't even try and hide it. And that's a good thing!

What I was expecting:

A game similar the other well known Zombie Shooter, but slower-paced and with all the UT stuff I've come to love, like Bots, Double Jumping, and Damage Bonus pickups, and things like that. Like the other Zombie Shooter, but more 'arcadey', yet slower.

What I got:

A wave-based Zombie Shooter with an insane amount of maps, with many many free updates, but without Bots, Double Jumping, or any type of pickup (beyond weapons and ammo). It's very important to know the enemy type, especially the Special types, so that you can act accordingly.

As well as a basic 'waves' mode, there's also Objective Mode. This is basically the same, but a LOT more linear, and with objectives beyond 'kill stuff'. For instance, in one of the Objective maps, you have to use a welder to open safe doors and carry some gold bars to a certain place. Enemies just keep spawning while you do this, and while you're carrying the gold bars, your movement speed is slowed down.

*******************************************************************************************************

Here is a typical map play session for me, as a single player (because my people skills suck exactly as much as my internet connection does):

- Pick a map
- Pick a game difficulty (how hard the enemies will be) and game length (how many waves you want).
- For this example, I pick Normal difficulty, and Short. That means that the enemies will be reasonably tough, and the match will last for 4 waves + 1 boss wave.
- Start the gameplay session.
- Wait (a small amount of time) for loading
- The session has loaded! Time to choose a class (they're called Perks in this game).
- I pick Commando, because I want to be good at using automatic weapons for most of the session.
- I start the actual session, with the standard starting equipment of a Knife and a Pistol. If my Commando Perk was higher level, I'd get to start with an automatic weapon. But it's not, so I don't.
- Wave 1 appears. During Wave 1, I kill Zeds (the zombies) while keeping an eye out for an automatic weapon, or some armour (and yes it's spelt like that, because it's a British game).
- Wave 1 finishes. I now have 1 minute to get to the Trader so that I can buy an automatic weapon, or some armour. This is made easier by the fact that a red line appears between me and the Trader, and I just need to follow it. However, it's made annoying by the things that the Trader says. I think she thinks it's funny, or sexy. It's not. It's also irrelevant, so I can just ultimately ignore it.
- I get to the Trader. Do I want an automatic, or armour?
- I pick the cheapest automatic, because the armour is more likely to spawn on the map than an automatic.
- I've finished at the trader, but still have some time left, so I roam around waiting for the next wave, when I come across an automatic which spawned on the map. I facepalm until I hear the next wave arrive.
- Wave 2 begins. Tougher enemies appear this time, but I don't care, because I have an auto. If only I could have dual wielded the other one I saw! This reminds me that I can dual-wield pistols - which doesn't really help me right now.
- I finish wave 2, then get to the Trader. I buy the armour this time, and also buy more ammo.
- I've got, like 45 seconds left. I spent this looking for nearby item spawns so I can sell them to the trader. I find some armour has spawned, because OF COURSE I DO. I should point out that this isn't normal - but it's not rare, either. Just luck, is all. However, I still facepalm until the next wave, all the while reminding myself to check item spawns ON THE WAY to the trader next time, instead of AFTER.
- Wave 3 starts, which includes tougher enemy types again. I wish I had bought a better auto (instead of armour), but then I remember that we have grenades in this game. I use them and my auto to survive until the next round.
- I finish Wave 3, and forget to check item spawns on the way to the trader, because I am a moron.
- at the Trader, I sell my old auto and buy a much better gun.
- I don't bother buying armour, because I'm sure I'll find more body armour as an item spawn, which, of course doesn't happen.
- Wave 4 starts. I see one of the toughest enemies in the game, the Fleshpound. I nearly quit in sheer terror, but I manage to take them out. It only cost me most of my ammo, armour, and health. This is because I don't listen to the community about the correct way to take out a Fleshie, and just try to treat it like a normal enemy. This is because I am a moron.
- I (barely) defeat Wave 4.
- I make my way to the Trader, while she informs me that 'something really big is coming'. Given her previous comments, I think nothing of this at all, and just chalk it up to her stupid sense of humour (which is also spelt that way, because it's still a British game).
- I upgrade to a better auto, and replenish all armour and ammo (including grenades).
- I think to myself "Wait, I just finished 4 waves. Aren't I done here?" Then I remember about the final boss wave.

And if you want to know what happens in *that* wave...

...well, the game is still for sale. ;)

(Also, 'YouTube exists'. But I'm mainly concerned with the 'BUY THIS GAME' thing.)

Short review.
Killing floor has without doubt done it right, but of course there are some flaws ^^ :)

pros
- It works perfectly and smoothly, and the grafics is nice
- the mobs works great and good variation
- lots of weapons, of course some of them are quite useless(but luckily only a few)
- the perk system is great with its variations.

cons
- the perk leveling up is a pain in the **** , of course you should use some time to level up, but it takes a looooot of time, no fun in that...
- It is probably not really the game itself, but often in co-op people tend to camp, which means that you will likely use 90% of the time to sit on the same spot and hit the enymies in one directions. Of course the game developer has tried to remove this flaw by moving the trader around on the map, but yeah it often becomes dull very quickly.

"A serious co-op survival game".

I can¬¥t believe I didn¬¥t know about this game in 2009 (Too much Left 4 Dead media I guess), In many ways Its a better game. Its worth every single penny.

I love the way the single 9mm pistol handles, they did a superb job with It (feels so authentic). Best of all the guns. This is one of the few games where the guns feel real, "immersive" I would say, you almost feel you¬¥re actually firing the gun!. 

If you have an entry level APU like me (Athlon 5150) this is one of those games that needs to be in your HTPC.

Seriously, get this game, you wont regret It.

UPDATE: After playing Killing Floor 2 for free I can tell this game is better in many ways, one of the first things is "gun sounds" compare the 9mm pistols, the SCAR, The Hunting Rifle despite is a Whitelisted gun, etc. KF1 really asks you to co-op or you will die for sure. The difficulty and balance in this one is superb. KF2 is not a bad game overall, just wish they could have imported so many features from here.

All the maps are fun but of course, some more than others. Killing the patriarch is incredibly satisfying even if it's very difficult. Only downside I can think of is that level up classes takes centuries.
